ul_466909: sh -cm

screen -d -m -L sh -cm 'nohup zenity --info --text test >&/dev/null & echo'

screen -d -m -L sh -cm 'zenity --info --text test >&/dev/null </dev/null & echo'

Explanations about Options.-m: Enable job control (default for interactive shells).
Explanations about Options.-c: Impose a size limit of n blocks on the size of core dumps.
Explanations about Options.-i:
Integer attribute. n specifies the base to use when displaying the integer
 (if not specified, the base given in the first assignment is used).
 Parameters with this attribute may be assigned values containing arithmetic
 expressions.

Explanations about Options.-a:
Read items from file instead of standard input. If you use this option, stdin
 remains unchanged when commands are run. Otherwise, stdin is redirected from
 /dev/null.
